subtitle: Federal government spending equals approximately 22–23% of GDP. Shutdown halts approximately 6% of discretionary spending.

economic_loss.banner: Each week of shutdown costs $7–15B in economic activity

header.title: The Slice of GDP That Stops

items.title: Federal workers unpaid
items.detail: Approximately 900,000 employees furloughed; approximately 700,000 working without pay.

items.title: Contractors miss payments
items.detail: Most contractors do not receive back pay.

items.title: Services halted
items.detail: Passports, permits, IRS processing, national parks operations slowed or paused.

items.title: Household spending declines
items.detail: Retail, dining, and travel demand decreases.

items.title: Market volatility increases
items.detail: IPOs and ETF launches delayed; volatility rises.

consumer_confidence.title: Consumer Confidence Index (CCI): 2025 Shutdown
consumer_confidence.note: Estimates subject to revision. Source: Conference Board

items.title: Tourism operations reduced
items.detail: National parks, museums, and monuments reduce operations.

items.title: Economic releases suspended
items.detail: Jobs reports, GDP data, and inflation statistics delayed.

items.title: Credit rating review possible
items.detail: Extended shutdown increases sovereign credit review risk.

items.title: Debt ceiling considerations
items.detail: Concurrent fiscal policy disputes could compound uncertainty.

items.title: Assistance program disruptions
items.detail: Housing, childcare, and nutrition programs face delays or suspensions.

items.title: Private sector employment effects
items.detail: Extended shutdown could result in private-sector workforce reductions.

items.title: Contractor payment delays
items.detail: Halted payments create cash flow challenges.

items.title: Regional economic effects
items.detail: Local businesses near federal facilities experience revenue declines.

items.title: Limited compensation options
items.detail: Most small contractors ineligible for back pay.

items.title: Investor monitoring
items.detail: International investors observe U.S. fiscal policy developments.

items.title: Trade negotiations
items.detail: International partners may defer agreements during uncertainty.

items.title: Geopolitical observations
items.detail: Competing nations reference governance challenges in diplomatic contexts.
